title: These 39 New Arrivals Have "Future Viral" Written All Over Them
text: With cooler weather finally coming into view and the fall/winter 2024 collections beginning to land in stores, I've been keeping close tabs on the best new arrivals, and there's so much to discuss. Now that the fall looks are making their way into our carts and onto the street, it's time to report on what is actually resonating in the wild. Let's face it—not everything we loved on the runway will translate into a practical item worthy of our already-maxed-out closets.That said, there are a number of breakout hits that have "viral" written all over them, whether it's the pretty roll-neck top from Carven, the elegant Toteme slingback flats that are already infiltrating our social feeds, or the Elsa Peretti stone necklace that the celebrity set is swapping diamonds for. The 39 new arrivals below may have only just become available, but they're already set to define the season and the rest of 2024 as we know it. I'm certain these will go on to achieve major fame both on and offline, and not to brag, but I'm usually right. KHAITE Simona Snake-Effect Leather Shoulder Bag It should come as no surprise that Khaite's highly wearable east-west shoulder bag is the style every chic person is wearing right now, specifically in this snake print. I liked this look on Bally's fall/winter 2024 runway but fell even more in love when Saoirse Ronan wore it during her recent press tour for her upcoming film The Outrun. Toteme Patent Leather Slingback Wedges These perfect flats deserve to be in your closet immediately. A new The Row bag just dropped! Only Miuccia Prada can get me to wear this saccharine shade of pink, and I'm more than okay with it. Toteme Draped Fringed Wool-Blend Bouclé Coat And now, a longline version of the viral Toteme scarf coat that fashion people just can't quit. Gigi Burris Lauren Wool-Felt Pillbox Hat Every chic person you know will be wearing a pillbox hat this winter. Gigi Burris is a name to know in millinery. Louise Trotter's Carven collections continue to be insider favorites, and now that the pieces from the acclaimed F/W 24 show have finally hit the market, there are already several favorites to emerge, like this roll-neck top that was styled on the runway with a textured pencil skirt and almond pumps. Tiffany & Co. x Elsa Peretti Bean Necklace Elsa Hosk and Rosie Huntington-Whiteley are both swapping their diamonds for stone jewelry, more specifically these crafty Elsa Peretti pendants. Bottega Veneta Medium Liberta Leather Shoulder Bag ABADIA Suri Paneled Twill and Crinkled-Voile Maxi Dress This emerging label out of Saudi Arabia is behind some of the most showstopping dresses. Prada Cutout Leather Flats Gucci Half Moon Leather Shoulder Bag The color, the shape, the glossy finish—everything about this has It item written all over it. Wardrobe.NYC x RHW Blazer Dress The Row Milla Satin Flats Saint Laurent SL 596 Dune Optical Eyeglasses Corporatecore is happening if Saint Laurent has anything to say about it. Proenza Schouler Stilsman Legging Proenza Schouler styled several looks on the spring 2025 runway with elevated leggings layered underneath dresses and long coats, and this is your cue to mirror the styling trick. Cape-like silhouettes are all I can think about at the moment. KHAITE Cedar Glossed-Leather Pumps Khaite's latest shoe release is a pair of glossy pumps with a square peep toe. Controversial? Sure. Viral? Guaranteed. Louis Vuitton Le Damier de Louis Vuitton Large Ring Inspired by the iconic Damier checkerboard print. Alaïa Faux Fur-Trimmed Wool Turtleneck Midi Dress The silhouette of this dress means everything to me. Carven Semi-Sheer Midi Skirt The styling possibilities are endless here. I can't stop staring at this double C chain strap. Saint Laurent La Scandale Sandals in Patent Leather Scandale indeed! These pumps feature a peep-toe details that's about to have the fashion community divided. Loewe Balloon Jacket in Nappa Lambskin This is everything I've ever wanted in a leather jacket and then some. Sleek and minimal, this reminds me of a vintage watch in the best way. CARVEN Scarf-Detailed Crepe Midi Dress I truly can't think of anything more elegant than this dress. Alaïa Le Teckel Medium Leather-Trimmed Printed Calf Hair Shoulder Bag Spotted calf hair makes this iteration of the already-viral Le Teckel bag even buzzier. Ferragamo Lysandra Patent-Leather Pumps Prediction: T-bar pumps will be the next heel trend to know. Loewe Belted Shirt in Cotton Inventive yet utterly wearable, Jonathan Anderson has done it again. If the popularity of the fishnet flats was any indication, these are set to be huge. Burberry Belted Long Coat Daniel Lee's take on British wardrobe classic continues to surprise and delight us. Bottega Veneta Lauren 1980 Teen Leather Clutch Bottega Veneta took inspiration from Lauren Hutton in the 1980 film American Gigolo for this bag. Gucci GG Shadow Wool-Blend Bouclé Bomber Jacket Loro Piana Bale Micro Leather Tote Bag Loro Piana makes some of the very best mini bags out there. I highly encourage clicking in to see this on the model. BALLY Belle Small Leather Tote Anna is an editor on the fashion team at Who What Wear and has been at the company for over five years, having begun her career in the Los Angeles office before relocating to New York, where she's currently based. Having always been passionate about pursuing a career in fashion, she built up her experience interning at the likes of Michael Kors, A.L.C., and College Fashionista before joining the team as a post-graduate assistant editor. Anna has penned a number of interviews with Who What Wear's cover stars over the years, including A-listers Megan Fox, Issa Rae, and Emma Chamberlain. She's earned a reputation for scouting new and emerging brands from across the globe and championing them to our audience of millions. While fashion is her main wheelhouse, Anna led the launch of WWW Travels last year, a new lifestyle vertical that highlights all things travel through a fashion-person lens. She is passionate about shopping vintage, whether it be at a favorite local outpost or an on-the-road discovery, and has amassed a wardrobe full of unique finds. When she's not writing, you can find her shooting street imagery on her film camera, attempting to learn a fourth or fifth language, or planning her next trip across the globe.
html:
With cooler weather finally coming into view and the fall/winter 2024 collections beginning to land in stores, I've been keeping close tabs on the best new arrivals, and there's so much to discuss. Now that the fall looks are making their way into our carts and onto the street, it's time to report on what is actually resonating in the wild. Let's face it—not everything we loved on the runway will translate into a practical item worthy of our already-maxed-out closets.

That said, there are a number of breakout hits that have "viral" written all over them, whether it's the pretty roll-neck top from Carven, the elegant Toteme slingback flats that are already infiltrating our social feeds, or the Elsa Peretti stone necklace that the celebrity set is swapping diamonds for. The 39 new arrivals below may have only just become available, but they're already set to define the season and the rest of 2024 as we know it. I'm certain these will go on to achieve major fame both on and offline, and not to brag, but I'm usually right.

KHAITE

Simona Snake-Effect Leather Shoulder Bag

It should come as no surprise that Khaite's highly wearable east-west shoulder bag is the style every chic person is wearing right now, specifically in this snake print.

I liked this look on Bally's fall/winter 2024 runway but fell even more in love when Saoirse Ronan wore it during her recent press tour for her upcoming film The Outrun.

Toteme

Patent Leather Slingback Wedges

These perfect flats deserve to be in your closet immediately.

A new The Row bag just dropped!

Only Miuccia Prada can get me to wear this saccharine shade of pink, and I'm more than okay with it.

Toteme

Draped Fringed Wool-Blend Bouclé Coat

And now, a longline version of the viral Toteme scarf coat that fashion people just can't quit.

Gigi Burris

Lauren Wool-Felt Pillbox Hat

Every chic person you know will be wearing a pillbox hat this winter. Gigi Burris is a name to know in millinery.

Louise Trotter's Carven collections continue to be insider favorites, and now that the pieces from the acclaimed F/W 24 show have finally hit the market, there are already several favorites to emerge, like this roll-neck top that was styled on the runway with a textured pencil skirt and almond pumps.

Tiffany & Co. x Elsa Peretti

Bean Necklace

Elsa Hosk and Rosie Huntington-Whiteley are both swapping their diamonds for stone jewelry, more specifically these crafty Elsa Peretti pendants.

Bottega Veneta

Medium Liberta Leather Shoulder Bag

ABADIA

Suri Paneled Twill and Crinkled-Voile Maxi Dress

This emerging label out of Saudi Arabia is behind some of the most showstopping dresses.

Prada

Cutout Leather Flats

Gucci

Half Moon Leather Shoulder Bag

The color, the shape, the glossy finish—everything about this has It item written all over it.

Wardrobe.NYC x RHW

Blazer Dress

The Row

Milla Satin Flats

Saint Laurent

SL 596 Dune Optical Eyeglasses

Corporatecore is happening if Saint Laurent has anything to say about it.

Proenza Schouler

Stilsman Legging

Proenza Schouler styled several looks on the spring 2025 runway with elevated leggings layered underneath dresses and long coats, and this is your cue to mirror the styling trick.

Cape-like silhouettes are all I can think about at the moment.

KHAITE

Cedar Glossed-Leather Pumps

Khaite's latest shoe release is a pair of glossy pumps with a square peep toe. Controversial? Sure. Viral? Guaranteed.

Louis Vuitton

Le Damier de Louis Vuitton Large Ring

Inspired by the iconic Damier checkerboard print.

Alaïa

Faux Fur-Trimmed Wool Turtleneck Midi Dress

The silhouette of this dress means everything to me.

Carven

Semi-Sheer Midi Skirt

The styling possibilities are endless here.

I can't stop staring at this double C chain strap.

Saint Laurent

La Scandale Sandals in Patent Leather

Scandale indeed! These pumps feature a peep-toe details that's about to have the fashion community divided.

Loewe

Balloon Jacket in Nappa Lambskin

This is everything I've ever wanted in a leather jacket and then some.

Sleek and minimal, this reminds me of a vintage watch in the best way.

CARVEN

Scarf-Detailed Crepe Midi Dress

I truly can't think of anything more elegant than this dress.

Alaïa

Le Teckel Medium Leather-Trimmed Printed Calf Hair Shoulder Bag

Spotted calf hair makes this iteration of the already-viral Le Teckel bag even buzzier.

Ferragamo

Lysandra Patent-Leather Pumps

Prediction: T-bar pumps will be the next heel trend to know.

Loewe

Belted Shirt in Cotton

Inventive yet utterly wearable, Jonathan Anderson has done it again.

If the popularity of the fishnet flats was any indication, these are set to be huge.

Burberry

Belted Long Coat

Daniel Lee's take on British wardrobe classic continues to surprise and delight us.

Bottega Veneta

Lauren 1980 Teen Leather Clutch

Bottega Veneta took inspiration from Lauren Hutton in the 1980 film American Gigolo for this bag.

Gucci

GG Shadow Wool-Blend Bouclé Bomber Jacket

Loro Piana

Bale Micro Leather Tote Bag

Loro Piana makes some of the very best mini bags out there.

I highly encourage clicking in to see this on the model.

BALLY

Belle Small Leather Tote

Anna is an editor on the fashion team at Who What Wear and has been at the company for over five years, having begun her career in the Los Angeles office before relocating to New York, where she's currently based. Having always been passionate about pursuing a career in fashion, she built up her experience interning at the likes of Michael Kors, A.L.C., and College Fashionista before joining the team as a post-graduate assistant editor. Anna has penned a number of interviews with Who What Wear's cover stars over the years, including A-listers Megan Fox, Issa Rae, and Emma Chamberlain. She's earned a reputation for scouting new and emerging brands from across the globe and championing them to our audience of millions. While fashion is her main wheelhouse, Anna led the launch of WWW Travels last year, a new lifestyle vertical that highlights all things travel through a fashion-person lens. She is passionate about shopping vintage, whether it be at a favorite local outpost or an on-the-road discovery, and has amassed a wardrobe full of unique finds. When she's not writing, you can find her shooting street imagery on her film camera, attempting to learn a fourth or fifth language, or planning her next trip across the globe.
